NewsLines.HeadLine: Reuters World News Digest at 1400 GMT, Sep 23

NewsLine.NewsLineText: DIGEST:Reuters World News Digest at 1400 GMT, Sep 23

body.p: BERLIN - Germany faced the prospect of continued economic stagnation on Monday after Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder won Sunday's election with a reduced majority that narrowed his scope to implement painful reforms.

LONDON - Britain said on Monday a draft U.N. Security Council resolution on Iraq would be tabled within days and would make it clear to Saddam Hussein that he must honour previous commitments and disarm.
RAMALLAH - Israeli and Palestinian officials held their first talks on Monday since the army imposed a siege on Yasser Arafat's West Bank headquarters, but failed to end the four-day-old standoff.

YAMOUSSOUKRO - French troops sent to help Westerners trapped by a bloody military uprising set up camp on Monday on the road to Ivory Coast's second city, where dozens of American children are among foreigners in hiding.

MERIDA, Mexico - Hurricane Isidore plowed across Mexico's Yucatan peninsula on Monday, forcing thousands from their homes as it flooded streets, toppled trees and power lines and shut down offshore oil rigs.

VLADIKAVKAZ, Russia - Rescuers battled to find about 100 people still missing on Monday after a weekend glacier-slip in the Caucasus mountains as meltwaters from the fallen ice poured into villages and drove out residents.

BRATISLAVA - Slovak centre-right parties kicked off talks on the makeup of the country's future government after winning weekend elections that are seen securing the country's entry into the EU and NATO.

SRINAGAR, India - Militants launched a string of attacks on security forces and political workers in Indian Kashmir on Monday as violence flared on the eve of a second round of a state assembly election, police said.

MADRID - A row between Spain and Morocco over a deserted Mediterranean islet flared up again on Monday after Rabat cancelled talks at the last minute, alleging Madrid had landed a military helicopter on the disputed island.
ABIDJAN - "Ivory Coast faces a possibility worse than a coup: an anarchic implosion of criminal violence... Or it may become an African Yugoslavia, but one without mini-states to replace the whole."
PEC, Yugoslavia - An Egyptian policeman with the United Nations in Kosovo stood trial on Monday accused of shooting dead his local interpreter when their love affair turned sour.
NEW YORK - The outdoor sport of petanque, hugely popular in village squares throughout France, is on a roll in New York City.
